bullets.text: Congress debates reclaiming authority as the executive branch expands under Trump’s second term, raising institutional and policy uncertainty.
Post-Watergate constraints on presidential power are eroding; expanded executive tools could reshape regulation, trade, and foreign policy implementation.
Trump-aligned Super PAC fundraising topped $100M recently, signaling sustained political spending power that can influence 2026 policy and election dynamics.
U.S. signals possible intervention if Iran violently suppresses protests, increasing regional escalation risk and potential oil-market volatility.
An oil tanker evading U.S. Coast Guard scrutiny highlights maritime enforcement tensions tied to sanctions and global energy shipping routes.
Ørsted legally challenges Trump’s halt of a $5B offshore wind project, underscoring U.S. regulatory risk and potential slowdown in renewables buildout.
BYD surpasses Tesla as top global EV seller; competitive pressure intensifies across pricing, margins, and supply chains, especially outside China.
Tesla reports 418,227 Q4 deliveries (down 16%), reinforcing demand concerns and raising stakes for product refreshes and price discipline.
Berkshire enters the Greg Abel era as Buffett exits; governance transition could shift capital allocation assumptions and investor risk premiums.
Markets remain bifurcated and AI-led; chip stocks extend a multi-year rally, increasing concentration risk and sensitivity to earnings disappointments.
Saks leadership shake-up and bankruptcy reports signal stress in leveraged retail; refinancing costs and weak demand continue to pressure department stores.
Report of NY Fed cash transfers to banks surging in Q4 2025 raises questions about hidden liquidity strain and backstop dependence in parts of the system.
A glyphosate/Roundup study retraction renews uncertainty over carcinogenicity evidence, potentially affecting regulation, litigation exposure, and agrochemical valuations.
Denmark data show HPV vaccination cut oncogenic HPV16/18 prevalence from 16% to under 1%, implying major long-run cancer prevention and health-system savings.
xAI’s Grok faces regulatory and reputational backlash over sexualized child images; India orders fixes, highlighting rising compliance costs for generative AI platforms.
